CatDescriptText: Mr. Donald Singleton, porter, Fifth Ward and Mr. Leon Dash, chauffeur, Third Ward, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 23, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think race relations are improving or worsening in Pittsburgh?" Mr. Donald Singleton's answer reads: "Improving, but there is room for a lot more improvement."  Mr. Leon Dash's answer reads: "They will be improving and as time goes by, a lot which is hidden will come to light and more persons will realize that they are acting childish and foolish-- in other words, just indulging in kids' play.  We're all beginning to realize that we are all needed to live together and this is the only way we're going to have strength and unity."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Donald Singleton wearing wool hat, moustache, dark coat with loop closures, and striped scarf, standing in front of building; Portrait of Leon Dash wearing fedora, plaid shirt, and zippered leather jacket, standing in front of building
